description: From Latin cyathus (“cup”) +‎ -form, from Ancient Greek κύαθος (kúathos). Compare French cyathiforme.

adjectives.description: cyathiform (comparative more cyathiform, superlative most cyathiform)

entries.meaning: In the form of a cup, a little widened at the top.
examples: Glaucous, hoar, enfouldered, cyathiform, / Making mere faculae of the sun and moon  […]
